360 seconds before 2:00 am

1,800 seconds before 8:11 AM

rounds.comments: (Alex: We want you to name the book in question.)

clues.text: Jake Barnes, Lady Brett & friends go to Spain; Lady Brett has an affair with a bullfighter, then returns to her fiance
Genius architect Howard Roark struggles to maintain his integrity in the face of mediocrity for some 700 pages
Stephen Dedalus' childhood, school days & early manhood, when he decides to leave Dublin for Paris to become a writer
clues.response: Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

clues.text: Lucy Honeychurch & her chaperon get the wrong room in Florence; Lucy falls for George, gets engaged to Cecil, weds George
Clyde Griffiths gets Roberta pregnant, falls in love with rich girl Sondra, lets Roberta drown, is executed
If I'd been there in 1862, I'd have given a drink to this general who beat the rebels at Shiloh
I'm all for youth, but can you believe this guy led an army to victory over the Thracians in 340 B.C. at age 16
This Mexican general let himself be surprised at the battle of San Jacinto, ensuring Texas independence
I gotta hand it to Gen. Gebhard von Blucher, 72 years old, commanding the Prussian troops at this June 1815 battle
This field marshal wasn't so bloody hot; his Operation Market Garden in 1944 resulted in a British disaster
Greece joined this military alliance in 1952, Bulgaria in 2004, though they're far from the body of water in its name
Most everybody was invited to join this post-WWI club founded in 1919, but the U.S. turned down a membership
Members of this club formed in 1993 include Latvia, Lithuania & Luxembourg--sorry, Libya, you're not invited
This not-very-exclusive club founded in 1995 has 153 members (& they weren't too welcome in Seattle)
The 8-member club formed by this treaty shutskied its doors in 1991
An interconnected group of TV stations that broadcast the same programming
An estimate based on little or no information
Timepiece mechanism that's a synonym for efficiency
2-word phrase for a set of values based on diligence; it often follows "Protestant"
An embankment constructed as a fortification

7 letters:
Phil Collins,
Mike Rutherford,
Tony Banks

4 letters:
Of a drama,
of contrition,
of mercy
10 letters: OMG!  We learned Amy was Fabio's long-lost sister!  & that's the only item we uncovered!  The sole singular one!
12 letters: Why?!  Why didn't I buy Microsoft when it hit the market in 1986?!  & wearing that Speedo?!  What was I thinking?!

6 letters:
Learned Hand, Joseph Crater (once "the most missingest man in America")

rounds.category: WHEN YOU WISH UPON A CZAR

clues.text: Talk about a bad heir day! Living up to his name in 1581, he murdered his only viable heir (& his namesake, to boot!)
In 1745 the man who'd become Peter III wed this 16-year-old German princess; she ruled after his deposing & dispatching
He succeeded his dad, Alexander III, & ruled from 1894 to 1917
Coming to power in 1855, Alexander II realized this war wasn't going well & made peace in 1856
First name of the man who was Godunov to be czar for 7 years after the extinction of the Rurik dynasty
Win an Academy Award & you'll go home with this golden guy
The name of this towerlike framework over an oil well comes from that of a 17th century hangman
"Rags To Riches" crooner Bennett could tell you it means "stylish"
Derived from Scottish Gaelic, it's a narrow, secluded valley, as Ms. Close might tell you
You might remember that this herb with needle-shaped leaves is a traditional seasoning for lamb
Tom was born the son of a coal miner in Pontypridd in this U.K. country
Pirate radio airplay broke "It's Not Unusual", Tom's first hit, after this U.K. radio behemoth refused to play it
That must be one swingin' pad for "Amore": In the mid-'70s, Tom bought a Bel-Air mansion from this suave rat packer
In 2009 Tom raised the first pint at the Guinness 250th anniversary celebrations in this city
To benefit Afghan refugees, Tom duetted on "Delilah" in Modena, Italy with this one of the three tenors
There are 86,400 of these in every day
There are about 10,000 species of these, including carpenter, driver & leafcutter
Belonging to nearly 2.4 million people as of the 2000 census, it's the USA's most common surname
From 1938 to 2003, Volkswagen hatched more than 20 million cars of this model
Take a deep breath & tell us the name of this most abundant element in the earth's crust
The 12th century chronicler Florence of Worcester mentions this lady, but not her ride
Britannica calls Lady Augusta Ada, daughter of this rakish 19th c. poet, "the world's first computer programmer"
"Our Lady of" this Mexico City neighborhood is said to have appeared to a believer in 1531
Abbey Theatre director Lady Augusta Gregory was the patron of this poet she met in 1896
U.S.-born Jennie Jerome married a lord in 1874; that same year, she gave birth to this future prime minister
Tom Hanks grows up a little too fast
Santa & Will Ferrell do a little North Pole dancing
Kevin Costner chases assassination conspirators
Will Smith hooks & jabs
Dennis Quaid is running out of time trying to figure out who poisoned him

rounds.text: "The Gold Bug", Edgar Allan Poe's story about the search for Captain Kidd's buried loot, helped inspire this 1883 novel
